adverbs.description: observably (comparative more observably, superlative most observably)

entries.meaning: (degree) To a detectable degree, sufficient to be observed.
examples: As the planet orbits the star, it causes a wobble in the star's motion, which can be detected as a small but observably large Doppler effect.
From the point of view of earth-based observatories, the effect of the planet's orbit around the star is that the star observably wobbles.

entries.meaning: (modal) Indicates that the proposition can be verified by observation.
